data.title: A swell retreat
data.text: A pleasant room with a lovely bath in a great old home not far from the center of Carmel.  The public spaces are very inviting and comfortable.  There were delightful snacks and beverages available to us the afternoon of our arrival.  The innkeepers accommodated my husband's need for gluten-free food easily (I guess that is what happens when you are a chef and each breakfast is cooked to order!).  The breakfast was beautiful and satisfying, and we enjoyed that chance to visit with other guests and the owners (and their little dog, too!)  If you cannot do stairs, this is not the place for you as the bedrooms are all up a staircase, and the bathroom (at least in our room) was two steps down from inside the bedroom.

data.title: Absolutely the Best!!!!
data.text: My husband and I stayed last week-end and it was the best, most relaxed stay we've had in along time.Loved the windows all open when we arrived and the breeze coming in was so fresh... Really enjoyed the bed, so comfortable we slept great!  The food and our coffee and pasties served to us in our room each morning was wonderful and. It was nice that Kelly and Joe asked what time we would like that served and breakfast done each morning. They are both so warm and gracious and they sure made our stay perfect!  Would go again in a heartbeat and recommend to family and friends!  It was the bomb!

data.title: Charming b & b and charming hosts
data.text: Kelly and Joe are amazing. They have thought of everything. We didn't want to leave and we are recommending this b & b to our family and friends who live in the Midwest.  It has every last charming detail you could imagine. Joe and Kelly are very accommodating for vegans too. The next time we are in the Midwest area we will make a plan to come back. I can't imagine a better bed and breakfast.

data.title: Should Be Rated 6 Stars!
data.text: I had to come to Carmel for a conference and soon discovered there were almost no hotel rooms left in the city. The bed and breakfast was recommended by a friend who lives locally and I am SO glad he did. I have stayed in many top of the line hotels like the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton, and I would pick this bed and breakfast over any of them. The couple that own the B&B couldn't be any nicer! She owned a bakery and he was a chef. To say that the food is to die for is an understatement. The crumble that I enjoyed at breakfast and the homemade beer cheese soup were worth the airfare to get there. This is a "Do not miss"!!

data.title: Great Bed and Breakfast
data.text: Great B&B with great location.  Joe and Kelly are warm and gracious hosts.  The house is perfect and the breakfasts are suburb.  Every little detail is thought of, including the delicious macaroons in your room to the little chalk board welcoming you.  Be sure to say “Hi” to Teddy.  He’s really not a fox.  If you’re a race car fan ask Joe about Kelly’s car and get him to REV the engine.  Great sound.  Get a glass of wine (or two) and sit on the front porch and relax.  We’ll be back.

data.title: Comforts of home - even better!
data.text:
I was working in the area and decided to take a much needed break from hotels.  I chose here because of proximity to work and also because of the reviews.  I could not have been more pleased!  Kelly and Joe are just the best host and hostess ever.  I was greeted and shown around.  They asked about my likes and dislikes in breakfast choices.  They personalized my stay to make sure my expectations were exceeded.  Between the great tasty treats in the evening after work and the incredible breakfasts in the morning, I felt spoiled!  Not only was the breakfast incredibly tasty, the presentation was amazing!  The coffee was wonderful (which is one of my favorite things in the world in the mornings).The room was a delight!  It was decorated lovely and the bed and pillows could not be beat.  

The front porch is perfect for a glass of wine and a good book after work which I can vouch for personally. The neighborhood is warm and welcoming.  This lovely, quaint B&B is within walking distance of a wonderful area of art and boutique stores.  There are several restaurants as well.  

I truly felt at home, welcome, and spoiled in my stay and I have every intention of going back.

Don't miss the opportunity if you have the chance to come to this area.  You won't be disappointed. 

I posted one pic of breakfast. I wish I would have taken more to share.  My family was jealous:)

data.title: Great B&B for Carmel, north Indy area!
data.text: We stayed at the Old Towne Carmel B&B while going to see the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band at the Carmel Palladium.  The B&B and the owners were great, breakfast was wonderful and location was really convenient.  Less than 5 minutes to great restaurants and a cool downtown arts district in Carmel and close to the Monon Trail. Nice neighborhood with user friendly hosts!

data.title: Charming
data.text: Loretta and Doug are the most hospitable folks. They went above and beyond to make my stay special. Loretta makes almost everything from scratch and everything was delicious. The place and rooms are absolutely gorgeous too. The area around the BnB is so charming and there are many places within walking distance. You will love your stay here. I plan to come back. :)

data.title: Romantic Weekend Stay
data.text: This Bed and Breakfast was simply amazing.  The owners are wonderful with extreme attention to their guests.  Breakfasts were customized to my restricted dietary needs (food allergies) and they were absolute bliss!!  Evening treats were a huge surprise and allergy friendly as well.  We least liked the fact that time did not permit our staying a third night.

data.title: Exceeded Our Expectations!
data.text:
Loretta and Doug, the owners, were exceptionally accommodating and our stay was delightful.  When we arrived, Doug met us in the driveway with the offer to help with our luggage.  As we entered their home, Doug pointed out the 24-hour coffee and tea service.  We inquired about the availability of skim milk for the tea.  Doug thought they had none, but in the morning a small pitcher of skim milk miraculously appeared.  

At breakfast, we discovered that Loretta had gone to the trouble of preparing a separate dish of apple crisp "without nuts" to accommodate my wife's allergy.

The house is pristine, the beds very comfortable (no quilts as someone else mentioned), and the breakfast was indeed "gourmet" - several types of juice, homemade apple crisp, sausages from the local butcher, blueberry pancakes with lemon zest, eggs with chives from the garden, and freshly brewed coffee.  Delicious!

data.title: All these 5 ratings are deserved!
data.text: Used TripAdvisor to find a B&B halfway  between Columbus & Chicago, and the previous ratings ALL were right on. Great, friendly, helpful hosts. Extremely clean and neat house. Fabulous made from scratch breakfast (accommodating to gluten free). Location is walking distance to shops, dining, and trails.

data.title: Wow
data.text:
My husband & I were traveling from NY to Wisconsin making different stops along the way & found this wonderful spot between 2 of our planned stops. What a treat! Carmel is a nice little town that has a lot to offer from restaurants & art to the great Monan Trail to enjoy the great outdoors. 
But the B&B was a great place to go after enjoying the local area. It is impeccably clean, the bed is so comfortable,the home made breakfast items were amazing & the owners Doug & Loretta were so kind & helpful. My gluten allergy did not hinder having delicious pancakes & homemade strawberry shortcake, what a treat!
If you have a chance to visit Carmel, Indiana, I highly recommend staying here.

data.title: Perfect Get-Away
data.text: This was my first experience at a bed and breakfast and I could not have been more impressed. From the moment we pulled into their driveway, we felt pampered. Doug and Loretta are the perfect hosts. They were friendly, and made us feel at home. Located just off the Monon Trail, the B&B was perfectly distanced from food, shopping, and the Arts District. We left our car at the house and walked everywhere. Breakfast was incredible! This could not have been a better stay for us, and we have a desire to return.

data.title: Hospitality at it's Best
data.text: I recently had a business trip to Carmel, Indiana and wanted to stay the night close to the center of town.  There were no hotels close so I looked for a B&B and luckily found OLD TOWNE CARMEL B&B.  What a beautiful place of calm and hospitality.  The room was well-designed with plenty of sun and room and furnishings.  It was comfy and private with a bathroom that was just right.  The front porch with hanging ferns and rocking chairs was the perfect place to really exhale while sipping coffee and reading the paper.  The breakfast was, hands down, the best I've ever had at ANY B&B ANYWHERE...kudos to Loretta (cook/owner).  Doug & Loretta made the place feel like the home of a good friend or family member...and my business trip became a mini-vacation...I will certainly return.

data.title: A perfect stop....
data.text: We were catching up with friends who live in Carmel, and my husband picked this spot.  It's in a delightful location, very close to the terrific shops and restaurants in Carmel, and it's been converted to a simply lovely b&b by the owners.   Parking  was convenient and in their driveway.  It's a cute 100 year old Victorian house with an interior beautifully decorated with many furniture items from the owner's time spent in Hong Kong.  the juxtaposition of the two styles works towards a beautiful and restful environment.  The owners are everything B&B owners should be:  they love doing what they do, the breakfast was multi-itemed and all delicious, and served with joy and attention to detail.  Our king--sized bed was very comfortable, and we had a great sleep - also important!  We regretted we were only there for one evening, and we would return.

data.title: Wonderful Stay....Old Towne Carmel B&B in Carmel, Indiana
data.text:
So may great things to say.....Where to start.....
The renovated home was as pretty as the pictures on the website.
Rooms were spacious & clean. Beds with nice linens and comfortable. Thermostat for every room & Fresh flowers from the garden on the bedside table. 
Kitchenette area downstairs for the guests.
A small tray of treats every night and delicious homemade healthy breakfast in the morning. 
Breakfasts consisted of Homemade cinnamon rolls, Croissants, Eggs with fresh herbs, yogurt from local farm with fruit and homemade granola. Bacon, sausages and even a slice of lemon meringue pie if you like!
The inn keepers considerate, friendly and helpful with local knowledge of activities and events.  
The B&B is conveniently located in a safe neighborhood just 2 or 3 blocks from the small artsy town of Carmel and the Monon bike trail. We will definitely be back!

data.title: A Charming B&B with Lovely Hosts
data.text: My sister and I just spent this past weekend at Old Towne Carmel B&B for a "sisters" weekend. First, the location is perfect...walking distance to the Arts & Design District of Carmel. Second, the home is a renovated 115 year old home which is inviting and cozy, the colors bright and cheerful. Third, the hosts Loretta and Doug are great!  They are welcoming, friendly, go out of their way to make you comfortable and so very nice. Fourth, Loretta makes great breakfasts and feeds you well...all homemade from the scones to the jams to the waffles. You will not go hungry with her breakfasts.  An example of our first breakfast - breads, lemon-blueberry scones, fresh fruits, juices/coffee/tea, yogurt parfait, egg casserole, crispy bacon and waffles. I was stuffed!  Finally, you get a sweet treat in the afternoons like cupcakes or chocolate crinkle cookies, both so moist and yummy. I was so happy to have found this delightful B&B. I suggest trying Bazbeaux for an inexpensive pizza dinner or Donatello's for Italian fare.  While you are walking the Arts & Design District, stop at the Simply Sweet Shoppe for candy, Bath Junkie to make your own body scrub and the wonderful farmer's market on Saturday mornings. Look for all the great life-like statues along the streets in the District. They're great. Most importantly, take my advice and stay at Old Towne Carmel Bed & Breakfast.  You'll love it as much as me!

data.title: A Trifecta!! You have to stay here!!
data.text:
Clean, Comfortable and Charming....An amazingly clean B&B.  Our hosts couldn't have made our visit more comfortable and enjoyable....from the warm chocolate cookies the evening we arrived to the delicious continental breakfast including fresh bread and apple crisp.  My wife and I truly felt it was as close to home as you could get.  Carmel is equally as charming as our accommodations.  It's easy to understand why Money Magazine rated it best city in the U.S. to live.  Dinner is only a short walk away to a delightful intimate downtown full of shops and restaurants.
For the same cost as staying in a noisy hotel chain by the freeway and listening to the air conditioning unit go on and off all night, treat yourself to the Old Towne Carmel B&B  and rediscover what outstanding customer service is really like!! I guarantee you won't be disappointed!!  It's a trifecta!!

data.title: Comfortable Stay
data.text: Stayed a very comfortable four nights at Old Towne Carmel--so we really got to see the depth of Loretta's culinary expertise and it is noteworthy. Breakfast was a bountiful feast each morning, with yogurt parfaits, an egg dish, meat, pancakes, fruit and pastry, much of which is homemade or locally sourced, including the granola and jams and jellies. In the evening, there was always a just-baked sweet treat sitting on the sideboard. My gluten-free dietary needs made for a lot of extra effort on Loretta's part, but she never once skimped and always had something special that I could eat. Very nice stay. And it's within walking distance of the historic downtown arts district.

data.title: 4.5 stars!
data.text:
We just stayed one night in this excellent b&b.  The house is beautiful and immaculate.  Rooms are cleaned by the innkeepers, Dave and Loretta, themselves.  Loretta is a self proclaimed neat freak, which I can greatly appreciate.

Our room, the Anna Lynn, was lovely and very comfortable.  A great night's sleep.  A b&b without a quilt!!  Exactly what we look for, and that can be hard to find.  Loretta and Dave have great taste.  Bathroom meets your needs but isn't terribly spacious (e.g. standard shower/tub).  

Breakfast was filling and good.  Not the very best we've had at a b&b because that's hard to beat (we've stayed at many).  Some locally grown things and all homemade.  

Thanks for a great stay...we recommend with two thumbs up!
